body_html: In theory yes they can be run in parallel, but in practice implementing group convolution in this way is very inefficient. I have timed it. This is why NVidia explicitly provided acceleration of group convolutions in CuDNN. There is a group option for nearly a year now. All the Tensorflow developers need to do is propagate it to the parameters of conv2d.

body: In theory yes they can be run in parallel, but in practice implementing group convolution in this way is very inefficient. I have timed it. This is why NVidia explicitly provided acceleration of group convolutions in CuDNN. There is a [group option](https://blog.yani.io/cudnn-filter-groups) for nearly a year now. All the Tensorflow developers need to do is propagate it to the parameters of conv2d.
